Wet labs often use human-readable construction files to succinctly describe a set of reactions.

These construction files often refer to Parts, or DNA sequences with an encapsulated function, by name. For example, pUC19 is a plasmid backbone, and referred to by name in our GFP cloning.

PCR primer1/primer2 on pPROBE_GFP (pcr_product) Digest pcr_product (EcoRI/HindIII, fragments) GelPurify fragments (L, probeDigested) Digest pUC19 (EcoRI/HindIII, fragments2) GelPurify fragments2 (pUC19Digested) Ligate probeDigested and pUC19Digested (final) >primer1 gagctcgaattccctaactaactaaag >primer2 ctaattaagcttattaagctac
